member.name: T:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxAnalysisSettings
member.summary: Contains the configuration items to analyze the measurement result.

remarks.para:
This class provides the settings for analyzing the measurement result. The following properties are available to configure the settings for each measurement.
for the PPP-BOTDA measurement.
for the S-BOTDR measurement.
for the TW-COTDR or PC-TW-COTDR measurement.
for the BOTDR measurement.
for the AT-BOTDA measurement.
For the details, please refer to the chapter Analysis Settings in the NEUBRESCOPE Help System.

member.summary: Gets or sets the value that indicates the power of noise. The unit is dB.

member.name: P:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxAtBotdaAnalysisSettings.AtModeInitialFilePath
member.summary: Gets or sets the file path for the Amplitude Transfer Mode initial data of the AT-BOTDA measurement.

remarks.para: The data in the specified file are used to detect frequency shift in variation measurement.

note.para: The specified value must be full path. It is used by the NEUBRESCOPE software. The location referred by relative path could be different for the NEUBRESCOPE and the user program. To avoid the confusion, full path should be used.
To convert to full path, the method can be used.

remarks.para: For the details, please refer to the section Initial Data in the NEUBRESCOPE Help System.

list.item: The specified value is an empty string ("").
The specified value is not full path.

member.name: F:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxCapturedData.Spectrum
member.summary: The data for each frequency are captured to make spectrum. The instrument captures the data for each frequency then transfers them to the PC. After capturing and transferring data for all the frequencies, center frequency for each spectrum is calculated in PC by software.

member.name: F:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxCapturedData.CenterFrequency
member.summary: Only center frequency is captured for each point. The instrument captures the data for each frequency as well, however, they are kept in the instrument. After finishing all the capture, center frequency is calculated in the instrument by hardware, then transferred it to the PC.

member.name: T:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxMeasurementMode
member.summary: Defines the values that show how the measurement is performed.

remarks.para: For the details, please refer to the section Measurement Mode in the NEUBRESCOPE Help System.

member.name: F:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxMeasurementMode.Normal
member.summary: Specifies to use standard algorithm to measure the fiber under test.

member.name: F:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxMeasurementMode.Progressive
member.summary: Specifies to use special algorithm to improve signal noise ratio (S/N) for better resolution.

member.name: T:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxSegmentType
member.summary: Defines the values that show the type of a segment that specifies how it is handled.

remarks.para: For the details, please refer to the section Segment Type in the NEUBRESCOPE Help System.

member.name: F:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxSegmentType.Strain
member.summary: Indicates that the fiber in this segment is used to measure strain.

member.name: F:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxSegmentType.Temperature
member.summary: Indicates that the fiber in this segment is used to measure temperature.

member.name: F:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxSegmentType.TemperatureReference
member.summary: Indicates that the measurement result in this segment can be used to compensate the influence of the temperature for another segments.

member.name: T:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxFittingRegionSelection
member.summary: Defines the values that specify the method to select the points for the center frequency fitting calculation.

remarks.para: For the details, please refer to the section Fitting Region Selection in the NEUBRESCOPE Help System.

member.name: F:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxFittingRegionSelection.ByFrequencyStep
member.summary: The points for the fitting calculation are selected according to the frequency step in the hardware settings.

member.name: F:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxFittingRegionSelection.ByLevelFromPeak
member.summary: The points for the fitting calculation are selected by the value specified in the "Level from Peak" property.

member.name: T:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxCenterFrequencyWhenFittingFails
member.summary: Specifies the value of the center frequency when the fitting calculation fails.

remarks.para: For the details, please refer to the section Center frequency when fitting fails in the NEUBRESCOPE Help System.

member.name: F:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxCenterFrequencyWhenFittingFails.ZeroGHz
member.summary: The result is 0 GHz when the fitting calculation fails. This selection can be used to easily distinguish the failed points.

member.name: F:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxCenterFrequencyWhenFittingFails.MaxInSpectrum
member.summary: The result is the frequency where the power is largest in the spectrum. This choice is useful to get reasonable result for the failed points.

member.name: T:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxReferenceDataSelection
member.summary:
Defines the values that show the selection of the reference data used in the frequency difference calculation.
Supported by NBX-SR7000.

summary.font: The method calculate the frequency difference by using the initial data file.
The method calculate the frequency difference by using the previous measurement data.

member.name: T:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxExecutionResult
member.summary: Defines the execution result of the measurement or adjustment.

member.name: F:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxExecutionResult.NotExecuted
member.summary: The operation has not been executed yet.

member.name: F:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxExecutionResult.Completed
member.summary: The operation has successfully completed.

member.name: F:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxExecutionResult.Aborted
member.summary: The operation has aborted.

member.name: F:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxExecutionResult.ErrorOccurred
member.summary: An error has occurred during the operation.

member.name: F:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxExecutionResult.LoopBreakError
member.summary: Too much power loss was detected in the fiber under test during the operation.

member.name: T:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxOutputAdjustmentStep
member.summary: Defines the steps in the output power adjustment for the pump and probe laser.

member.name: F:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxOutputAdjustmentStep.SetUp
member.summary: Indicates that the preparation for the pump laser adjustment is in progress.

member.name: F:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxOutputAdjustmentStep.CrosstalkPhase1
member.summary: Indicates the first phase of the crosstalk power adjustment for the pump laser.

member.name: F:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxOutputAdjustmentStep.CrosstalkPhase2
member.summary: Indicates the second phase of the crosstalk power adjustment for the pump laser.

member.name: F:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxOutputAdjustmentStep.CrosstalkPhase3
member.summary: Indicates the third phase of the crosstalk power adjustment for the pump laser.

member.name: F:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxOutputAdjustmentStep.Phase
member.summary: Indicates the phase adjustment for the pump laser.

member.name: F:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxOutputAdjustmentStep.Rx
member.summary: Indicates the power ratio adjustment for the pump laser.

member.name: T:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxFittingStatus
member.summary: Defines the status of the center frequency fitting result.

member.name: F:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxFittingStatus.OK
member.summary: The center frequency fitting calculation has successfully finished.

member.name: F:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxFittingStatus.FittingFailed
member.summary: The center frequency fitting calculation has failed by the reason other than the defined one.

member.name: F:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxFittingStatus.FrequencyStepIsZero
member.summary: The configured frequency step is 0 MHz and unable to calculate the center frequency.

member.name: F:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxFittingStatus.PeakBelowNoiseLevel
member.summary: The peak value of the spectrum is less than the specified noise level. The noise level can be configured by the properties NbxPppBotdaAnalysisSettings.NoiseLevel for the PPP-BOTDA measurement, NbxSBotdrAnalysisSettings.NoiseLevel for the S-BOTDR measurement, or NbxBotdrAnalysisSettings.NoiseLevel for the BOTDR measurement.

member.name: F:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxFittingStatus.PeakTooLeft
member.summary: The position of the spectrum peak is too left and there are not enough points for the fitting calculation. Please adjust the frequency range for the measurement.

member.name: F:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxFittingStatus.PeakTooRight
member.summary: The position of the spectrum peak is too right and there are not enough points for the fitting calculation. Please adjust the frequency range for the measurement.

member.name: F:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxFittingStatus.RegionSizeLessMin
member.summary: The number of selected points for the fitting calculation is less than necessary minimum. In case that "By level from peak" is used for the "Fitting Region Selection", please specify larger value for the "Level from Peak" to include more points for the fitting calculation.

member.name: F:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxFittingStatus.ReferenceLevelSearchFailed
member.summary: The points are not found in the spectrum whose level from the peak are greater than the specified value. By adjusting the frequency range, the points could be found. The level from peak can be specified by the properties , , , or in the class.

member.name: F:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxFittingStatus.PolynomialCoefficientANotNegative
member.summary: The quadratic polynomial coefficient "a" for the fitted curve is not a negative value. This means that the fitted curve is convex downward and the peak is not appropriate for the center frequency.

member.name: F:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxFittingStatus.PolynomialCoefficientBNotPositive
member.summary: The quadratic polynomial coefficient "b" for the fitted curve is not a positive value. This means that the peak of the fitted curve is outside of the region for the selected points.

member.name: F:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxFittingStatus.ATModeInitialDataFittingFailed
member.summary: The fitting calculation for the AT mode initial data has failed.

member.name: F:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxFittingStatus.ATModeMeasuredFrequency
member.summary: The measured frequency for the AT mode variation measurement is greater than the center frequency of the initial data spectrum. Please use smaller frequency for the variation measurement.

member.name: F:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxFittingStatus.ATModeSignalLevelTooHigh
member.summary: The measured signal level for the AT mode variation measurement is greater than the peak value of the initial data spectrum. Using smaller frequency for the variation measurement could decrease the signal level.

member.name: T:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxResult
member.summary: Provides access to the results produced by the NEUBRESCOPE software.

remarks.para: The properties and methods in this class enable to handle the results generated by NEUBRESCOPE. The methods support to open measurement data files and save the measurement result. The property provides access to the object that represents the measurement result in the NEUBRESCOPE software.
Please refer to the chapter Results in the NEUBRESCOPE Help System. It helps to understand the overview of the NEUBRESCOPE results.

member.name: P:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxResult.MeasurementResult
member.summary: Gets an object that represents the NEUBRESCOPE measurement result.

member.name: M:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxResult.OpenMeasurementData(Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxOpenMeasurementDataSettings)
member.summary: Opens measurement data files and retrieves the contents to the measurement result.
member.param: A object that specifies how to open the measurement data files.

remarks.para: This method opens the measurement data files as specified by the parameter . The contents of the data files are read into the measurement result, then the analysis results, such as temperature and strain, are calculated. The property can be used to access to the measurement result.

When more than one measurement data files are opened, the routes in the data files must satisfy the conditions shown below.
The contents of the object must be the same.
The contents of the object must be the same.
The values of the and properties in the object must be the same.
The operation for the measurement result is not allowed when the measurement is running. Attempting to do causes an .

member.exception:
Possible reasons are as follows:
The measurement data file specified in is not found.
The contents of the measurement data file specified in are not valid and unacceptable.
Executed during the measurement is in progress.

member.name: M:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxResult.SaveMeasurementResult(Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxSaveMeasurementResultSettings)
member.summary: Saves the contents of the measurement result.
member.param: A object that specifies how to save the contents of the measurement result.

remarks.para: This method saves the contents of the measurement result as specified by the parameter . The saved files are written to the folders under the current session. Files for the measurement data are written to "RawData", while those for the analysis result are saved to "Result".
If the file with the same name as the saved one already exists in the session folder, it is overwritten and replaced with the new one.
In case that the specified result type in is not involved in the measurement, it is ignored and not saved.
The operation for the measurement result is not allowed when the measurement is running. Attempting to do causes an .

member.exception: Executed during the measurement is in progress.
member.returns: A object that contains information for the measurement result files saved to the storage.

This class provides the properties and methods for saving the contents of the measurement result. The items to complete are as follows:

Please refer to the chapter Saving Results in the NEUBRESCOPE Help System. It explains the save operation in GUI, which helps to understand how this class works.

member.name: T:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxSession
member.summary: Provides access to the NEUBRESCOPE session.

remarks.para: By using the properties and methods in this class, it's possible to manage the NEUBRESCOPE session and configure the measurements.

For the operations of the session, making a new session, opening an existing session, and saving the current session are supported. To configure the settings for the measurements, the property is available. The object contains all the necessary items for the measurement configuration.
For the details of the NEUBRESCOPE session and its folder structure, please refer to the chapter Session and the section Appendix C in the NEUBRESCOPE Help System.

member.name: P:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxSession.Route
member.summary: Gets an object that represents the NEUBRESCOPE route.

member.summary: Makes a new session with the default settings.
member.param: A that represents the name of a session to make. Only characters that are valid for the operating system file system can be used.
A that represents the description of a making session. This can be an empty string ("").
A that specifies the directory where the session is made. This must be full path.

note.para: must be full path. The specified directory is used by the NEUBRESCOPE software. The location referred by relative path could be different for the NEUBRESCOPE and the user program. To avoid the confusion, full path should be used.
To convert to full path, the method can be used.

list.item: or is an empty string ("").
is not full path.

member.summary: Makes a new session with the specified creation method.
member.param: A that represents the name of a session to make. Only characters that are valid for the operating system file system can be used.
A that represents the description of a making session. This can be an empty string ("").
A that specifies the directory where the session is made. This must be full path.

member.summary: Provides access to the NEUBRESCOPE route.

remarks.para:
The NEUBRESCOPE route is a collection of settings to measure a fiber under test. It consists of the following items:
Measurement Settings represented by the class.
Hardware Settings represented by the class.
Segments represented by the and classes.
Analysis Settings represented by the class.
Optical Switch Settings represented by the class.

member.name: M:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxMeasurement.StartRoute
member.summary: Starts a set of measurements for the route.

remarks.para: This method starts a set of measurements for the route. The status of the measurement is shown by the events issued by this class.

This method returns just after starting the measurements. The user program can keep running during the measurement execution. To wait for finishing the measurement, call the or method. To detect the end of the measurement, catch the event.

The measurement can be started in the condition described below.
The instrument state is ready; and
A measurement is not running.
To check the instrument state, the class can be used. The method shows whether a measurement is running or not.

member.exception:
An error occurs for the operation of the service. Possible reasons are:
The instrument state is not ready.
Another measurement has already been running.

member.name: M:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxMeasurement.Stop
member.summary: Stops the on going measurement.
member.remarks: This method stops the on going measurement. In case that the measurement is not running, this method does nothing.

member.name: M:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxMeasurement.WaitForFinish
member.summary: Waits for finishing the measurement execution.
member.returns: Returns when the measurement execution finished. This method does not return until finishing the measurement execution.

remarks.para: This method waits for finishing the measurement execution. When the measurement is not running, this method returns immediately.

This method does not return until finishing the measurement execution. To do something while waiting for finishing the measurement, please consider the following alternatives.
To use the method. It returns on finishing the measurement or elapsing the specified timeout. In case that the measurement has not finished, call the method again until finishing the measurement.
To catch the event. This event shows finishing the measurement execution.
To call the method periodically to check whether the execution finished or not.
Calling this method overload is equivalent to call the method overload with specifying for the parameter.

member.returns: Returns when the measurement execution finished, otherwise .

remarks.para: This method waits for finishing the measurement execution or elapsing the specified timeout. When the measurement is not running, this method returns immediately.

member.exception: is a negative number other than -1, which represents an infinite time-out.

member.name: T:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxNeubrescope
member.summary: Provides access to the NEUBRESCOPE User Programming service.

remarks.para:
This class provides access to the NEUBRESCOPE User Programming service. By using the service, the following operations for the NEUBRESCOPE software can be accomplished.
Managing the NEUBRESCOPE session.
Configuring the NEUBRESCOPE route.
Starting and stopping the NEUBRESCOPE measurement.
Handling the NEUBRESCOPE measurement results.

The first step to use the NEUBRESCOPE User Programming service is to make an instance of this class. The created object allocates the necessary resources, then establishes a connection to the service.
To use the service on a local host, please make an instance by using the constructor . It creates an instance and connects to the service provided on the local host.

To connect to the service runs on a remote host, the constructor
can be used. The created instance makes a connection to the service on the remote host specified by the arguments.
The created object provides members to access each functionality of the NEUBRESCOPE software. The members can be reached by the following properties:
To finish using the NEUBRESCOPE User Programming service, the method must be called. It closes the connection to the service, then releases all the allocated resources.

The communication timeout error occurs in the conditions described below. If a timeout error has happened, the connection cannot be used any more. Please dispose it and make a new one.
A response for a request took more than 1 hour.
No communication for more than 24 hours.

member.name: M:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxNeubrescope.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class to connect to the service on the local host.
member.param: A that represents the name of this client for the NEUBRESCOPE User Programming service. The name is displayed in the NEUBRESCOPE windows and used to identify each clients.

remarks.para: This method initializes a new instance, then establishes a connection to the NEUBRESCOPE User Programming service runs on the local host.

Before making a connection to the service, please check the following points:
The NEUBRESCOPE software runs on the local host.
The NEUBRESCOPE User Programming service is provided for the local host. The service can be configured through the dialog brought up by the Tools/Options menu. The status of the service is displayed on the User Programming Status panel popped up from the status bar on the NEUBRESCOPE main window.

member.exception: An error occurs for the connection to the service.
An error occurs for the operation of the service.

member.name: M:Neubrex.Neubrescope.UserProgramming.NbxNeubrescope.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class to connect to the service on the remote host.
member.param: A that represents the name of this client for the NEUBRESCOPE User Programming service. The name is displayed in the NEUBRESCOPE windows and used to identify each clients.
A that specifies the host to which this client connects.
An that specifies the port number used to connect to the service. Valid range is 0 <= <= 65535.

remarks.para: This method initializes a new instance, then establishes a connection to the NEUBRESCOPE User Programming service runs on the remote host by using the specified and .

Before making a connection to the service, please check the following points:
The NEUBRESCOPE software runs on the specified remote host.
The NEUBRESCOPE User Programming service is provided for remote hosts. The service can be configured through the dialog brought up by the Tools/Options menu. The status of the service is displayed on the User Programming Status panel popped up from the status bar on the NEUBRESCOPE main window.
The specified host name and port number matches with the one provided by the service on the remote host.
The Windows Firewall or optionally installed security device/software does not block the TCP/IP connection for the NEUBRESCOPE service on the configured port.

member.exception: An error occurs for the connection to the service.
An error occurs for the operation of the service.
